subject: Add virtualbmc-core group
commit_message:
Add virtualbmc-core group

In order to grant repository level permissions to a new
core reviewer for virtualbmc, we realized that we need
a group for that purpose like our other repositories.

As such, requesting the addition of virtualbmc-core group
such that we can manage permissions for the repository and
grant core reviewer powers without requiring changing the
ironic-core group.

After merging, we will naturally need ironic-core added to
the group, so we can orchustrate/change the permissions with
in the group and add the new reviewer as a group member.

subject: Allow connection query string to be passed separately.
commit_message:
Allow connection query string to be passed separately.

The Nova project has made the decision to store the entire
contents of the "sql_connection" field in the database, with
alterations to the host value, such that various "cells" database
URLs can be located using Nova's database itself as a central
registry of database URLs.

This architecture has produced several problems.   The first
is that it is impossible to apply parameters to the URL that
are local to the client machine; the leading example of this
is the MySQL "bind_host" variable, which must match the hostname
of the connecting host.  Because cells puts these URLs into the
database and shares them with all controllers, we have to use a workaround
with the read_default_file parameter to specify a controller-local
file of options; this is not a standard thing
for other database drivers, and these parameters only apply to
the MySQL driver and not the SQLAlchemy engine.

The next issue is that it is inconvenient to add parameters
to the URL at all, once Nova has already been running, as one
must manually use Nova's command line tools
to alter all the URLs that have already been copied into the database
and alter the query parameters with each of those individually,
and then restart *all* services who will all receive the parameter
(no way to add params to just one controller).

Nova's "store the URL in the database" feature only needs to be able
to locate the host / database name of the alternate database,
and not change the URL tuning parameters.   This patch adds a new
oslo.db parameter connection_parameters which allows the params to
be applied separately from the sql_connection parameter, so that
Nova can continue persisting sql_connection but the parameters remain
local to the nova.conf file.   A URL parameter that truly had to remain
persisted in Nova's database (there aren't any) could still be applied
at the sql_connection level.

This feature is essential not just so that we can again place
simple parameters into controller-local files like "bind_host", but
also to allow for configuration of SQLAlchemy features such as
plugins that do connection pool monitoring.

Change-Id: Id4de4b09ec4719cbf8b372629fcf58cf368a33d4
(cherry picked from commit 9993efdeef4606f78182d084e4120a158a4e64b8)

subject: Revert "Update resources once in update_available_resource"
commit_message:
Revert "Update resources once in update_available_resource"

This reverts commit c9b74bcfa09d11c2046ce1bfb6dd8463b3a2f3b0.

This is causing the ResourceTracker to report 0.0 allocation
ratio values to Placement inventory during the
update_available_resource periodic task because
_init_compute_node calls _copy_resources which copies over
the default allocation ratio values from config (default
to 0.0) but then we don't "fix" the 0.0 allocation ratios
via ComputeNode.save() (where ComputeNode._from_db_object
would actually hard-code the appropriate non-0.0 values)
before passing the 0.0 allocation ratios to Placement, which
results in NoValidHost errors during scheduling since
Placement doesn't think there are any valid allocation
candidates available.

subject: Simplify inserting apt keys into nspawn image
commit_message:
Simplify inserting apt keys into nspawn image

Bionic requires a functioning gpg-agent to run apt-key add. This means
that gpg-agent must be working properly in the chroot when the nspawn
image preparation script runs.

Previous changes [1] have enabled apt-key to communicate with gpg-agent
during the nspawn_hosts role checks, however the cache prep fails almost
every time when nspawn_hosts is used within other role checks.

This is not a new issue, debian-installer is affected too [2].

This change adopts the same route as d-i, and simply copies the host
/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d directory to the nspawn image, removing the
need for apt-key and in turn gpg-agent.

This is a re-implementation of https://review.openstack.org/588962
for nspawn.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/590431
[2] https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=851774

Change-Id: I3c56da445377d7ba27a623fb7ebe95c20d28a327

subject: Verify project-id when setting quota
commit_message:
Verify project-id when setting quota

this patch adds several things to attempt (on best effort basis)
to use incoming user token in the quota set request to ask Keystone
if the project id the quota being set on is actualy valid:

- added new [keystone] config section to hold session- and
  adapter-realated options for accessing Keystone enndpoint
- added a token- and service catalog-based user auth plugin to the request
  context
- use the above to construct a keystoneauth adapter for Identity service
  and attempt to GET on projects/{project_id}

  - only if the Keystone v3 catalog endpoint is not found, or
    the request returns 404 NotFound, we raise an error and return it
    as 400 BadRequest to client when attempting to change quotas for
    project.

This behavior is enabled by setting a new
[service:api]quotas-verify-project-id config option to True (default is
False for backward compatibility).

subject: Caching ResourceCollectionBase::get_members()
commit_message:
Caching ResourceCollectionBase::get_members()

Right now each time 'get_members()' method gets called a new list
is created with fresh instantiation of element type resources.

This ought to be optimized by returning the cached result in
case of repetitive invocations and should the need be to fetch
the refreshed result it would ideally reinstantiate the member
resources of the collection. Also, in case of any member resource
element within collection is being marked as stale, this handles
properly to return the refresh'ed resource if that is accessed
through this 'get_members()' method of the referenced resource
collection instance:

    res_collection_inst.get_members()[any_index].some_attr

to access the current (or live) value of 'some_attr' w/o the need
of recreating (read re-instantiating) the constituent element
resource instance.

Change-Id: I7885143baa430d4e088f99febd6f8bc1a4f99aea

subject: [DO NOT MERGE] Health service plugin
commit_message:
[DO NOT MERGE] Health service plugin

Health service plugin implements health check execution support for all
plugins available in the neutron server. Health service plugin maintains
a list of available health checks.

When a health check execution is requested, the health service plugin
determines check implementation according to combination of resource name
and check name (when health of particular resource has been requested
using its ID), or a combination of collection name and check name (when
no ID has been specified). The actual diagnostics is delegated to the
health check implementation.

Other plugins are expected to inherit HealthCheckBaseInPlugin mixin
available from neutron/plugins/common/health.py. Unless customization of
health check search paths is required, it is the only change required to
enable other plugins support for health checking.

Common health check discovery functions are available both for plugins
and agents in neutron/common/health.py. These functions are used to
dynamically determine available health checks. The functions follow the
same pattern that is already used for dynamic loading of API extensions.

subject: Ensure vif_details are unique per VIF
commit_message:
Ensure vif_details are unique per VIF

The Neutron framework assumes that the details of a vif are the same
cross all nics [1]. But with the macvtap agent they aren't! The vlan
detail might be different for each vif, depending to which network
it belongs to.

The current implementation had a big bug: If first a vif attached to
a vlan network was processed, the 'vlan' was stored in the instance
drivers self.vif_details variable. Now if after that a flat vif is
processed, self.vif_details did still contain the 'vlan' property.
The vif_details (including the vlan property) where sent over to
nova. Due to the 'vlan' property being present, nova was configuring
the macvtap with vlans, even though the vif belonged to a flat network.

The solution is to make a copy of self.vif_details each time we process
it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/7e3d6a18fb928bcd303a44c1736d0d6ca9c7f0ab/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_agent.py#L142,L143

subject: Fix delete_network() to do BEFORE and PRECOMMIT better
commit_message:
Fix delete_network() to do BEFORE and PRECOMMIT better

First, move segment deletion back to PRECOMMIT_DELETE, which
reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd,
"Delete segments on BEFORE_DELETE instead of PRECOMMIT".

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to
BEFORE_DELETE network event has created some bugs. In one of
them, it is not possible to delete a routed network, because
the segments cannot be deleted due to the fact that the
associated subnets still exist.

Making _delete_segments_for_network respond to PRECOMMIT_DELETE
introduces a StaleDataError with the standard attributes of the
deleted segments. To work around that, network_db is expired and
read again after notifying the PRECOMMIT_DELETE event in
delete_network in the DB core plug-in.

Second, create a BEFORE notifier in external_net_db to check if
there are associated floating IPs, so it can fail before we try
and delete the network.  The existing BEFORE notifier can then
be moved to PRECOMMIT.

Third, make _ensure_network_not_in_use() a BEFORE notifier,
since that better fits the design of how it is being used.

Closes-Bug #1697324
Closes-Bug #1732543

Change-Id: I5360847769120e4366629223ca5f93406ef9beb0

subject: Fail early deleting network
commit_message:
Fail early deleting network

In order to not delete the networksegments entry for a network,
we must check the network is not in use before issuing the
BEFORE_DELETE notification.

As a side-effect, this could trigger a false-positive if it
is an external network and there are associated floating IPs
configured on it - the notification code can only deal with
un-associated floating IPs.  So we must check for that condition
before calling the BEFORE_DELETE notifiers.

If SG rules change on a port, SG flows on this port will be recreated.

subject: Use existing value for policy enforcement on PUTs
commit_message:
Use existing value for policy enforcement on PUTs

The Neutron policy enforcement code currently uses the new value
of an attribute (on a PUT request) to validate access to that
same attribute. The reason it does that is because it must specify
a key-value pair for the policy enforcement code to judge whether
or not the role has access to modify it. However, instead of putting
the new value in that key-value pair, it should be using the existing
value fetched from the database, if it exists. If it does not exist,
the key-value pair should be generated and put into the resource
object being modified before the object is passed to the policy
engine. Then after the policy engine validates access successfully,
the object attribute should be given the new value to be put into
the database.

subject: Limit exception handling to calls within override_role
commit_message:
Limit exception handling to calls within override_role

Motivation: prevents false positives caused by test
exceptions matching the expected exception before or
after the ``override_role`` context is called.

This patchset changes expected_error_codes behavior [0] by checking
errors explicitly outside the override_role context. This is done
by introducing a new function to rbac_rule_validation that is
used for validating that the expected exception isn't raised too
early (before ``override_role`` call) or too late (after
``override_call``) or at all (which is a bad test).

This means that exceptions raised prior to override_role
call result in failure. The same goes for exceptions raised
after override_role -- except for those that are an instance
of BasePatroleException (which is valid for things like
RbacMalformedResponse getting raised intentionally).

The new exception that is introduced is called
RbacOverrideRoleException.

Unit tests are added for all validation scenarios described
above.

subject: Retry on MessagingTimeout to init compute RPC API during n-cpu start
commit_message:
Retry on MessagingTimeout to init compute RPC API during n-cpu start

When [upgrade_levels]/compute=auto, the RPC ComputeAPI client
gets the minimum nova-compute service version to determine the
RPC API pin version. This requires a roundtrip to conductor. If
nova-compute and conductor are starting around the same time, like
we see in our CI jobs, the call to conductor can hit an RPC
MessagingTimeout and kill the nova-compute service.

This change does two things:

1. Moves the RPC ComputeAPI client initialization to a bit
   later in the nova-compute service startup routine. Note
   that post_start_hook still runs before the service is
   joined to the service group in the service group API.

2. Adds a retry decorator which will retry for a total
   of three attempts to init the compute RPC API client. Failing
   that, nova-compute will still fail to start as before.

Change-Id: I6dc9bccbd51d7c3cdf3924cc41d87c2ee3f934b3
Closes-Bug: #1789484

subject: Make sure the branch to track is in YAML
commit_message:
Make sure the branch to track is in YAML

There is no reason to rely on comments in the files
used to bump the SHAs of upstream repositories.

Without this, a contributor can easily add a comment
and break the tooling, which relies on regexps and
well formated files to behave.

Instead, as this is a YAML file, we should rely on
a YAML parser in the release tooling, for more
robustness.

This fixes the issues by adding an extra key
(_git_track_branch) per repository, showing what to track.
This could be used in release tooling, and is not hurting
the existing code, as the extra keys are not loaded:
Those files are only consumed by the py_pkgs lookup, which
won't read this extra key.

commit_message:
switch release job for networking-bgpvpn

The old release job uses tox to run setuptools commands. This requires
that the dependencies for the package being released also be
installable with pip.

The networking-bgpvpn package depends on networking-odl which depends
on a git URL for ceilometer, which is not on PyPI and therefore cannot
be installed with pip.

In order to unblock the rocky release for networking-bgpvpn, we go
ahead and switch the release job template to the new form of the job,
which uses the newer PTI and does not require tox to build the
package.
